Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bowl
Description: Large cooking bowl, which can be identified on the basis of its bottom, which is reinforced with alluvial clay applied with the fingers, and by the black soot that still covers the vessel. Its shape is regular (rounded bottom, restricted mouth and simple lip). The surface has been was smoothened on the inside with a brush and polished on the outside. Its colour varies from beige-orange to black. A decorative pattern of triangles filled with lines has been incised with care on the lip. This model is typical of the Middle Kerma period and more rarely among the C-Group.
